啊哈哈哈，碎碎念也是因为刚好看到The Economist发文

https://www.economist.com/asia/2020/01/11/why-was-australias-government-so-ill-prepared-for-the-bushfires



You might think that Australia is particularly vulnerable to forest fires. But that would be a mistake. ⁠
⁠
Many other countries share the same conditions that have set Australia ablaze, physically and politically, including similar terrain and a leadership that has yet to wake up fully to the new reality that climate change is creating.⁠
⁠
As a result, the lessons from Australia's tragedy are important.⁠


刚好土豪又是住澳洲的。那么巧= = 不传送都说不过去。

不然请放心啦，绝没有叫你们崇高目标出卖灵魂，或者崇拜小朋友搞的「环保邪教」。
自由世界，德行自证(巴氏名句/品葱第一名言)，后果自吞，崇高跟低贱也只不过是世俗的眼光。
